annotations.description: The fans must be pleased with the show they have seen on the pitch today. There was no chance to get bored as the game was very attractive. Let's hope the players won't lose their passion and determination in the future matches. Manchester City were dominant and more threatening of the two sides. It was a fairly one sided match. The home side attempted to hold onto the ball for as long as possible, while the away side focused on defending and let the opposition keep possession.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That's the end of the match.

annotations.label: attendance
annotations.description: The attendance for today's match is 53892.

Manchester City slow the tempo of the game down by exchanging a combination of one or two touch passes. The opposition's players are finding it very difficult at the moment, very physically demanding to run without the ball.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: 3 additional min. will be played.
Fernandinho (Manchester City) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Lee Mason no option but to blow his whistle.
A pass by Gael Clichy (Manchester City) ends up in no man's land, and the attacking effort comes to an end. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Aston Villa.

Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) unleashed a monstrous piledriver. He controlled a pass, glanced up at goal and shot from the edge of the box. It could have been a difficult one for the keeper, but the ball fortunately hit one of the defenders and ball bounced away.

annotations.label: funfact
annotations.description: The ratio of the ball possession is 71:29.
Half chance! Jesus Navas (Manchester City) plays a pass into the box, but Brad Guzan reacts well to snuff out the attack.
The free kick is taken short by Manchester City.
Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) deprives his opponent of the ball, but the referee blows his whistle for a foul. He's not happy with the decision! Manchester City are awarded a free kick.
Bacary Sagna (Manchester City) collects a pass and has an effort from 22 metres out, but it flies just over the crossbar.

annotations.label: substitution

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Yaya Toure goes off the pitch and Manu Garcia (Manchester City) comes on.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) is penalised for a foul. Lee Mason had a clear view and blows his whistle.

Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) escapes without any punishment from the referee after using excessive force to foul his opponent. A free kick has been awarded to Manchester City.

annotations.label: funfact
annotations.description: 22:2 – the total goal attempt statistics.
Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) makes a strong challenge and Lee Mason blows for a foul.

Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 25 metres out, but he missed the right post by a whisker.
The Manchester City players are exchanging some short passes.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is going to take the penalty!

annotations.label: penalty
annotations.description: Lee Mason blows his whistle for a foul after Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa) hacks down one of his opponents. Manchester City are awarded a penalty. What an opportunity to score!

annotations.description: Remi Garde has decided to substitute Gabriel Agbonlahor and he is replaced by Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa).

annotations.description: Substitution. David Silva makes way for Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City).

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 4:0.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The corner from David Silva (Manchester City) is cleared away by the defence.

Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and produces a ferocious strike towards the left post, but his shot is well held by the goalkeeper. The ball goes out of play. Manchester City are awarded a corner kick.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Substitution. Wilfried Bony is replaced by Raheem Sterling (Manchester City).

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! David Silva puts a cross into the box and finds Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner. He makes it 3:0.

Quick reactions by David Silva (Manchester City) and Sergio Aguero, tricking their opponents with a cheeky chip pass. A beautiful football moment and great skill, which caused the noise in the stadium to go up a notch.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) connects with a pass but sees his shot from the edge of the box blocked.
Gabriel Agbonlahor (Aston Villa) plays in a hopeful cross, but it doesn't find its way to any of the attacking players.
Jordan Ayew (Aston Villa) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away.

Long passes, short passes and one two passes. Manchester City are showcasing great team work by keeping possession and producing pin point passes from player to player. The opposition's players are finding it very difficult to intercept at the moment.
Idrissa Gueye (Aston Villa) tackles a bit over zealously and Lee Mason blows for a foul.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 2:0.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal 1:0! David Silva laid the ball off to Yaya Toure (Manchester City), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Everything is set for the start of the second half.

The performance from both teams could be described as average. There have been only a few exciting situations and the fans will be expecting more in the second half. Manchester City dominated the opening period and easily created the most chances. The tactic of the home side is slow build up play, while the away team's main priority is a flawless defence.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The match has reached half time.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) misses a golden opportunity to score from inside the six yard box after firing the ball over the crossbar.

annotations.label: injury
annotations.description: Gabriel Agbonlahor (Aston Villa) is clearly asking for some medical attention with his painful gestures. The extent of his injury is yet to be discovered.
Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) thinks that he is fouled by his opponent, but the referee deems him to be the one who commits a foul and awards a free kick to the other team.

Jesus Navas (Manchester City) attempts to find his teammate with a pass from outside the box, but the opposition's defence is quick to react and thwarts the attack. The ball has crossed the sideline. Manchester City are taking a throw in.

Brad Guzan doesn't have to worry about that one. Gael Clichy puts a cross in towards Wilfried Bony (Manchester City), who is unable to keep his header on target from the centre of the box. He sends the ball well wide of the right post.

Fernandinho (Manchester City) is obviously not following the Golden Rule: „Treat others as you want to be treated.“ He makes a bad challenge and leaves Lee Mason with no other option than to blow for a foul.

annotations.label: lineup1
annotations.description: The starting lineups for this match have been revealed.

Hello to all football fans, we are here to bring you a live commentary of the following match, describing all the most interesting and important moments. We'll make sure you won't miss a thing, so just sit back and have fun.

The fans must be pleased with the show they have seen on the pitch today. There was no chance to get bored as the game was very attractive. Let's hope the players won't lose their passion and determination in the future matches. Manchester City were dominant and more threatening of the two sides. It was a fairly one sided match. The home side attempted to hold onto the ball for as long as possible, while the away side focused on defending and let the opposition keep possession.
